Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable trip”
Reviews.Author: Erin C
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at the Cascades Inn and this past weekend went back for our 10 year anniversary. We were greeted by a sign at the front desk congratulating us on our 10 year anniversary. Such a surprise and we felt super special. We got a king jacuzzi room. the room was nice and clean. It may be dated to some but it goes nice with the Branson country feel. We had no complaints about it. The jacuzzi in the room worked great. The pool was clean as was the hot tub in the pool area. The breakfast was nice, nothing major but it was free and filled us up. My only suggestion is maybe longer curtains because light did seep out underneath.( but with the air conditioner there I understand why they aren't longer. ) And maybe try to update exercise room. Other than that we had a great trip and cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very sad decline”
Reviews.Author: nastalie
Reviews.Content: My family used to stay at Cascades every summer and we moved there from what used to be the Ozark Mountain Inn after they turned it into a Travelodge. The last time I stayed I was with my parents and my 4 yr old nephew. The customer service was horrible and then a group of choir kids came piling in at 11:30 at night and were put on our floor where the adults let them run up and down the halls and scream and yell. I first asked the people to keep it down myself because I had a young child sleeping and they continued to do so. I called the front desk and they acted put out by having to ask them to be quiet. The clerk did come up and ask them to quiet down and still they did not so I called again and finally after the 2nd time they went to their rooms. This happened every night we were there. Also the breakfast was not as good as it had been in the past, the rooms were dirty and outdated. Another time before this last experience we had issues with the air conditioner and the smoke alarm going off at random times. When we contacted the desk about it they blew it off. Just not as good as it used to be and very sad that something that was such a joy when I was child has been allowed to go downhill so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good facility, extremely poor customer service!”
Reviews.Author: rnail1
Reviews.Content: Our family has been staying at this hotel for over 20 years. The facility has a wonderful pool and hot tub area. However, the last two visits, the hot tub has not been in service and the breakfast was lacking. The stay last week will be the VERY LAST for our family. The customer service was untrained, extremely rude and unhelpful, including telling us the hotel was out of towels. From check-in to check-out we were EXTREMELY DISPLEASED. In hindsight, we should have gone with our initial thoughts, which was to switch hotels at check-in!

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Too many hotels in Branson to choose from.”
Reviews.Author: Barbara T
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a weeks long vacation where we stayed at the Cascades. There were seven of us and we booked 2 rooms. We booked using hotwire. Bad mistake, You don't get to know which hotel until AFTER you pay. This was my first time using them and will be my last. We only saved $4.00 per night. Had I known where we were staying, I would never have booked. The hotel is pretty clean, but the rooms are very dated. The mattresses were so uncomfortable! You could feel the springs in the mattress and we didn't get the sheets changed all week. The sheets didn't fit the bed and kept "popping" off at the corners. The TV is a very old 19". Breakfast was a complete joke and was the worst ever! The lady taking care of it was so crabby and we never saw her smile even once, at anyone, the entire week. She acted like we were asking for her firstborn child when we simply asked for coffee. She got mad at my grandson because he took the last donut and she had to go get more. The biscuits are FROZEN and you have to microwave them yourself before you put the canned gravy on them. The breakfast menu is the same every single day. On our final day there, we didn't get breakfast. We went down an hour before it was to be over, and there was simply no food, no coffee made, nothing to eat! We left and had to spend another $65.00 for us to eat breakfast, when we had already paid for it. The jaccuzi was broken the entire time we were there. The pool water was cool, but the room where the pool is was like a sauna. You couldn't stay in there without melting. There is no ventilation in the pool area. The outdoor patio just outside the pool was dirty. Not inviting at all. It seems the employees use this space as a "smoking area". I will not go back to Cascades or use Hotwire.com. Cascades looks nice from the exterior, but buyer beware. There are too many good hotels in Branson that are the same price or less, and are far nicer. Know what you are paying for before you book!

Reviews.Title: “needs updated....”
Reviews.Author: kbart87
Reviews.Content: old and very uncomfortable mattresses... indoor pool and hot tub was cold oh and the TV was OLD... lol it kept going on and off while trying to watch a show breakfast was okay We will never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in management”
Reviews.Author: Debbie C
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here for years and have always been satisfied. However, during our last booked stay, we found out the management does NOT put customer service ahead of policy. We arrived before check-in time, but due to the fact our 1-year-old granddaughter had been carsick on the way and needed to be bathed, we asked for a room early. We were told that even though rooms were ready, we would be charged for two nights if we were allowed into our room early. Instead, we were provided with linens and soaps and cleaned our granddaughter in the public shower adjacent the pool (which was dirty and had only a dribble of water coming out). I left a written comment upon check-out, asking to be contacted by the manager (who was unavailable at the time of the incident and at check-out). I also called a few days later, leaving my name and number again. I have yet to be contacted by the manager, so I can draw no other conclusion than that she doesn't care how we feel about our experience. No wonder the whole fourth floor is vacant and unused, with treatment like that!

Reviews.Title: “Rip off!!!”
Reviews.Author: amber w
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here on our vacation, when we got to our "suite" we found the jacuzzi was in the bathroom and it was actually a dirty old tub that blew bubbles, our ac was broken, tv remote was taped up, we had two twins shoved together instead of a king, and dirty sheets. We were hoping to recieve the kind of service that was promised on the phone, I was very dissappointed and so was my boyfriend. Also the continental breakfast is gross. I was not pleased with this place at all, we had to move out of our room twice because everything was broke. >:/ I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 would be a lot better.”
Reviews.Author: Mechanic0383
Reviews.Content: I booked the honeymoon suite for a one night stay. My wife and I were married the day before. I thought this would be nice before we were able to go somewhere else. Wrong. I paid $140 for a 20 hour stay. We got to the room and found the ac to be turned up to blow hot air. I turned it down. After about 15 minutes it never started blowing cool air and the compressor was not kicking in. I called the front desk. They sent the maintenance man. He agreed that the ac was inop. He said he would change it out. I went to the front desk to see what they were going to do about this. They were not intending on doing anything about it. They certainly did not seem to care that this was our honeymoon and we chose to spend it there. I was literally told by the lady that " I turned the ac on too fast.". Really? That's absurd. So anyway the maintenance man was very nice. He did his job. Although the new ac was blowing cool, the room would not cool off. I was told by the front desk it would cool down in 15 minutes. I knew that was false also. After 6 hours I purchased my own fan so that we could sleep. By morning it was decent in there. The bed was horrible. The sheets did not fit. A lamp did not work. It was a clean place. Nevertheless I was treated like crap. I went to the desk twice to no avail. I wasted my money. Don't waste yours.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in 1990”
Reviews.Author: Josh1125
Reviews.Content: Value was there with this hotel. Pool was nice. Rooms have very small TVs and were stuck in an early 90's theme. Only major issue to me was the 1 elevator for a four floor hotel at full capacity. Would stay here again if I was low on options again.

Reviews.Title: “Metting room”
Reviews.Author: amandakay_12
Reviews.Content: I reserved a metting room for my sisters baby shower. I arrived early and paid for the room at the front desk which was $50. my sister doesnt live in branson so some of the guest were from out of town. After the shower was finished and we were cleaning up a lady came up to me and another guest and ask if we were just playing around here. We had two little girls with us i was confused and said No we are from the baby shower cleaning up. she was VERY rude and hateful and told us to vacum so we did. We then started carring the stuff outside getting ready to leave. The same hatful lady ask one of my guest who was paying for the room and why havent we paid yet.She was very rude to all my guest she ask more then one of them who was paying!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The guest came and got me and i showed this lady that we already paid. The front desk girl that was their when i paid already left. She never apolgized all she said was oh the other girl should have posted you paid. we cleaned the whole room and was treated terrible. I will never suggest to come to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: Glenn K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased a package online, sight unseen. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly clerk at the counter and was checked in in a mater of minutes. The room was spacious and comfortable, It was exactly what we were hoping for. Breakfast was good and the pool area was clean. Will use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Our 1st Choice”
Reviews.Author: CruiseSki
Reviews.Content: For more than 10 years now, we have stayed numerous times at the Cascades Inn when we visit Branson, MO. When our kids were younger they enjoyed it because of the huge indoor pool. The location is great and the prices are reasonable. We have always found the hotel to be clean. The breakfast has always been good too. If you're looking for a mid-priced hotel this has always been a great choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay over labor day”
Reviews.Author: felinefine12
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean we got one with double beds that looked out to the parking lot. The bathroom was clean however there was a yellow stain around the toilet and my husband said it was just a stain from the humidity in the bathroom, but it looked odd just being around the toilet. Small toiletries enough shampoo for 2-3 washings depending on how long your hair is and how many using it. We did go down to the pool, being labor day there was a few unsupervised kids there and the pool seemed to be a little over chlorinated which we were only able to stand for a little while which was bad since there were no towels by the pool and my husband had told the front desk and they said they would bring some down which they hadn't by the time we left so we ended up dripping up to our room. There is also a continental breakfast in the morning. It's decent nothing fancy and the donuts are cake donuts, which I don't care for, but they did have biscuits and gravy and well as cereals, coffee and juice. Overall it was a decent stay we got it on hotwire for $64. We had stayed there when we 1st got married so we knew the hotel and it had changed since we were last there, but not by much. Still a nice place to stay on a budget and in a good location for us since we were going to Silver Dollar City.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with the Cascades Inn.”
Reviews.Author: Dean W
Reviews.Content: They went out of their way to get things we asked for to make our stay a lot better. For three days our rooms were ALWAYS very clean, the breakfast was great, and the people at the front desk were always smiling.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING INN - OUTDATED - DO NOT LET THE LOBBY MISLEAD YOU!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy501961
Reviews.Content: Boy are we stupid for trusting this place again and again and again. This was our fourth stay and I could not say enough about how wonderful this place in the past........but you just wait and see. This being our 4th time was so shameful and I was so embarrassed for the owner/manager of this inn. There was blood on the bedspread and the pull out sleeper had no springs so the mattress fell threw bed. When called the front desk to complain the lady was extremely rude, stated she "wish she would have known sooner - 10:30 at night bedtime for most people IGNORANT WOMAN. She did, however, apologize, and moved us next door. She offered other rooms to the people sharing our room but must have had brain damage as previously that day they had over 500 guests leave and "none of their rooms were cleaned". Pleez be very alarmed by the disgusting bathrooms that are old and outdated, expect the shower, there are yellow/brown stains on the walls surrounding the toilet and sink area - bet you can't wait to brush your teeth in that sink!!!!!!!!!! If you ignore this REVIEW shame on me and if you stay here shame on you. This inn does have a handful of fabulous employees the owner/manager unfortunately is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Dunivan Family Reunion / July 21-24”
Reviews.Author: ricerb
Reviews.Content: We had a really great time. The cleaning staff was very cordial. Thanks for allowing us to use the dining area for us to visit. A special thanks to Debbie, Mary & Caitlin for all their help during our stay. They were very friendly. The continental breakfast was good also.

Reviews.Title: “Long time guests but NEVER again! Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lipglossd
Reviews.Content: A group of family members and myself stayed at this hotel on July 9-10, 2011. I knew the moment we walked in the lobby that we were in for some trouble. At the front desk were two employees...a guy and a young woman. The guy smiled and very nicely welcomed us to the hotel, the girl glared and looked away. I figured she might be having a bad day and let it go since the guy was so friendly. We had arrived a little early and just wanted to check if our rooms were ready by any chance...the guy said it was no problem at all and started to check us in when the girl shot him a nasty look and said NO! as rudely as possible. We were slightly taken aback by her behavior, but accepted the no and said we'd come back. We went into Branson, which is a lovely place with a lot to do, and shopped and watched a movie. We returned to the hotel a few hours later and the same two people were at the front desk and now the hotel owner was with them. Once again, the young man was very nice and welcomed us back and the owner said hello very nicely. The young woman just stared at her computer, completely ignoring us. They began checking us in and the entire time the owner, and the young man who turned out to be her son, were extremely friendly and helpful. We got to our rooms which are typical Branson fare...clean and simple, but fine for the reasons you're in town...everything was clean and nice as usual. We decided to go swimming in the hotel pool, which is also nice and clean, and ended up seeing the hotel owner's son there as well...he spoke to us nicely and seemed like a very nice person, just like his mom. We had a nice time swimming, then went to dinner and enjoyed the rest of our stay until check out time the next day. This time we arrive at the front desk and no one but the rude young woman is at the desk. No hello, no good morning, no "how was your stay?", NOTHING. She hardly looked up from her computer to acknowledge customers. I said hello, that we were ready to check out and gave her our last names. She stayed silent and "worked" on her computer....she then proceeded to accuse us of having not paid. We found this especially insulting since we pre-paid online and she confirmed that the day before. She obviously didn't believe us when we told her this and continued "working" on her computer, all the while sighing and treating us like a major inconvenience. She finally admits that we are correct and we ask if there's anything else she needs besides our room keys. She ignores us so we begin to leave when I hear, "UH!! I can't tell who you people are just from room keys! What room numbers are they?" This is odd to me since she spent so long on her computer and I assume such info is on the system...but I decided it wasn't worth dealing with such a cold person and once again gave her info she already had. She did not respond, not a single thank you or anything. We left feeling angry, insulted and definitely ready to find a new place to go regularly when visiting Branson, MO. Very sad since this has always been such a great place with nice staff. We have a lot of friends and family members who go to Branson for vacations....none of them will ever stay at this hotel again since our experience. I work at an accounting firm...which is a service based industry...if I treated one of my clients in the regard that this young woman treated us and other customers in the hotel I would not have my job. This employee did not wear a name tag and never introduced herself to us, but I overheard the owner's son call her "Catelynn" (spelling?) She is the entire reason this hotel has just lost customers and other future customers. I hope management takes care of this issue for their sake.

Reviews.Title: “Will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Exoticartz
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Branson so I booked this hotel online before I went. On check in, the staff was very friendly and helpful with all the going ons in Branson. The room was very clean and neat. The staff all around was just awesome. I will be bringing back the whole family and staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: evansc93
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2 connecting rooms for my daughters birthday. We were very pleased with the hotel. It is older, carpet and decor, etc... but very clean. We were impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The breakfast is just ok, cereal, donuts and biscuits and gravy. We will definately stay here again, and would recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “We shall return”
Reviews.Author: ghoeffken
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a new place to stay in Branson. We found it at Cascades Inn. We arrived early but they found us a room. The room was spacious, cool, one king size bed, 2 sinks, coffe maker, and small refrigerator. We also like the computerized key, not a card, for the door. We noticed a small problem with the television. It was quickly fixed after the cable company was called to install a new power box for the entire Inn. The continental breakfast included bisquits and gravy without sausage, which we prefer. Breakfast includes, English muffins, toast, bagels, donuts, cereals, juice, coffee, and a smile. We also like the AC in the run which does not run continuously but only as needed according to the temperature we set. Daily maid service was very good. The owners live on the property which lets you know how they feel. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Will think twice nefore returning”
Reviews.Author: 24stjohn
Reviews.Content: Took to long to check in. Desk staff was not as knowledgeable as most. Only one person at the desk at night, so no one to come to your room to help with problems, or you had to go to the desk to pick up your request. Ran out of food for complimentary breakfast. TV's not up to par. Noisy. Good location. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the stay and will be back”
Reviews.Author: DavidL71665
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay , every thing was as we needed. It was centraly located to the shows we want to see. great swimming pool for the Grand kids

Reviews.Title: “Our new home in Branson”
Reviews.Author: king_jack60
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on line, great location, very helpful staff, beautiful indoor pool, game room for kids, we will definately come back to this hotel for our summer trips!

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating for a school group!”
Reviews.Author: fsuhre
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Branson with a high school band. Cascades Inn was very accomodating for us. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. The pool area is nice, the price was very reasonable, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast was very good, it included pastries, cereal, and biscuits and gravy. I would definitely stay there again with family or a large group

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best !!”
Reviews.Author: htgolfer1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from October 22-26 and loved this Hotel. The staff was incredibly polite and helpful in every way. The owner even allowed my wife to take a start of some lemon grass that she had in a pot near the pool. The pool was very nice and normally empty. The breakfast was very adequate and the hostess kept things filled nicely with fresh biscuits and other foods. The location is literally right beside 3 great shows and its off of the 76 strip so traffic is MUCH better. My entire family loved the entire experience and we will be staying there again on our next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but dissapointed on past experience.”
Reviews.Author: angels622
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Cascades Inn again for the first time inn about 10 years. When our children were young it was the places we would stay due to the nice large comfortable rooms, large breakfast, and wonderful pool area. Well the breakfast is minimal now. Rooms are not as comfortable due to too firm of a mattress and towels that are thin and feel like sandpaper. The pool area is the only thing that remained as pristine. I will say that this place is kept clean as it gets. We will not be going back to this hotel due to the price for what you get. They even charge an extra $10 for a refrigerator which is usually provided at no cost at most of the comparable hotels in Branson. It took three phone calls to the desk one night to order a wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was terrible!”
Reviews.Author: joline4
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe my eyes when I read the other reviews for this hotel. I stayed here with my parents and 4 year old child and had a horrible experience. My mom made reservations for two double beds plus a roll away or pull out sofa. Upon arrival we were told it was against fire regulations to have a roll away/pull out sofa in a room with two double beds. Funny they didn't mention this when the reservations were made. The woman at the front desk was rude and completely unapologetic about the mix up. Furthermore they would not let us out of the reservation, so we had no choice but to stay. Once we entered the room I went to use the restroom and found the backside of the bathroom door splattered with blood! The bathroom sink still had hair in it and the tub looked like it had never been cleaned. We visit Silver Dollar City every year and will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: iservehim
Reviews.Content: We had a king suite with living room and master bedroom. The room was clean, the walls were clean, the tub was clean. The service was good, they were prompt on cleaning the room. The indoor pool/hot tub was great. The only thing I didn't like, was when you pull out onto Shepherds of the Hill EXPRway, you can't see due to the location of the sign. We almost got hit 2 or 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “we always stay at the cascades”
Reviews.Author: kim s
Reviews.Content: husband and i come to branson a couple of times a year to shop and fish. we always stay at the cascades. the location is perfect, the beds are super comfortable, we enjoy the pool and hot tub, and especially the value comes in the breakfast. they have a really good breakfast (included) which will fill you up so you don't need lunch. that saves us money. the only bad thing i could say about the cascades is the really awful smell in the stairwells and going out the exit doors. it could be cigarette smoke, but it's so much worse than regular cigarette smell. ??? we are just dashing up or down the stairs, so it's no problem for us. the rates are really good, and it's right next to shoji's theater, so it's close to 76 but without all the traffic and noise. WE LOVE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Wandering57
Reviews.Content: Very nice place on a budget. Great indoor pool area. The only bad thing was that there were water bugs in the pool area, but have been told by several people that this is a common occurrence in this part of the US. The rooms were nice, perhaps a little outdated. But I had stayed a few nights previously in another hotel across the street that was $30 more per night and I found Cascades Inn very comparable. I had excellent maid service. Room was very bright and airy - furniture is light which adds to the brightness of the room (compared to some other hotels I've stayed at where the dark furniture, bedspread and carpet made the room very bleak). All in all, a very nice hotel for a very decent price!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value and service.”
Reviews.Author: Wettoes
Reviews.Content: Having heard of Branson, MO on many tv shows, our family decided to find out what it was all about. We flew into Springfield, Missouri and were a little concerned that we might have made a mistake into coming to this part of the country, because it seemed a lot slower paced than we are used to in Southern California. But the people were very friendly and we were taken by the natural beauty of the area. We stopped at a tourist center and when we mentioned we wanted a nice, safe, clean hotel with a swimming pool for the kids, they directed us to the Cascade Inn. We were a little reluctant to rent a place sight unseen, but we were assured it was a very nice hotel, and we took it for one night. What a pleasure it was when we arrived and discovered it was all we were promised and more. AND THE PRICE!!!! Comparable hotel rooms in our part of the country would cost 2 or 3 times what we paid. And the staff was such a joy. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome and made suggestions on things to do and see, and they were never too busy to aswer our questions. We went ahead and stayed for 3 more nights.

Reviews.Title: “not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: arkansasmomof2
Reviews.Content: I had read on here that the rooms were clean, but needed updated. Cleanliness is my main priority. The first impression was that the room was clean. On the first night my husband had sat on the bed and got some grease off of his leg onto the bed. They didn't change the sheets, even with the black stuff on the bed. Then my 7 year old found a pill in the floor from a previous guest. I am so glad he knew not to take it. If he had of been younger it could of been bad. We stayed in the Jr Suite, for the four days we were there, a mattress was in the hall. Also if you are thinking about the Suite be advised that there is no air in the room with the sofa bed. We had to freeze to be sure enough air got into the room with our boys. The price for the suite was a reasonable, but had a lot of draw backs. The microwave looked to be one of the first made, and the T.V.'s did not show clear, and were very old.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the night, not a fortune.”
Reviews.Author: sanebrain
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean room. Indoor pool. Reasonable price. Cons: The hotel used to be a smoking hotel. Our "non-smoking" room smelled of old smoke. The bed was not comfortable and the pillows were flat. The hotel is aging and needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claytonandrew
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Branson. Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Clean older hotel with an excellent staff. The pillows need to be changed [4 half pillows]. Also need new mattress.Bed is just not comfortable. If they change bedding this would be an ideal place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kingkrusher2002
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best priced and cleanest hptels ive ever been in. Rooms were always clean and the staff were the nicest i have ever dealt with. Vending machines and ice on each floor was a nice perk. The free breakfast also saved us a few bucks. i cant wait until the summer of 08 to come back!! This time were staying much longer!!!

Reviews.Title: “3/31/07”
Reviews.Author: DGH07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3/31/07 based on the #1 rating on Trip Advisor. I'm not sure why this place would be ranked so high. It is an older (60's?) property that needs an upgrade with carpet, paint, etc. The rooms have no coffee maker or refrigerator. The free breakfast is just as bad as most places. It certainly was cheap ($55), and the people were all nice enough, but there are much better places.

Reviews.Title: “You can't get a better bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: Soonerguy29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellant! The rooms were clean, the staff was as gracious as the could have been, and the price was unbeatable. There are a lot of extras too, like the indoor pool, fridge in room, and great breakfast. The location off the strip was a blessing because it keeps you out of traffic!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: jen8301979
Reviews.Content: From the time I called to make the reservation the staff was great. Upon check in we asked the front desk if they knew of any good places to eat. We were given several places and a great map of Branson to get us there. The staff was great as well as our room. Everything was very well kept. I will stay there again on our next visit to Branson

Reviews.Title: “My fav place to stay in branson”
Reviews.Author: LRacing
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year. We take our two kids ages 8 and 5. They love the pool and hot tub and so do we. The elevator is glass so you can see out of it down over the pool. The kids like that as well. The pool has great access from every room we have stayed in. The service is great. Location is great. Best of all, the price is great. It has a game room with a pool table, arcade games, and vending. This place is just right. It's not usually too crowded, but in the summer it does fill up. Also, it does not have a fridge and microwave. (At least it didn't last time.) But again, when we're in Branson we don't spend much time in the room. Stay here and save your money for other fun stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Cascades Inn is very nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Cascades Inn is a very friendly place to stay. It is off the main road so you are out of the traffic but close to everything. The rooms we had (204 and 206) plus others on another floor, were clean and nice and large, even though they were not brand new. The king size bed was comfortable and the room quiet, and also dark at night like I like. There was a tiny nite light in the bathroom that was perfect if you needed to get up at night---just enough light--- but not too much light to keep you awake. The Jacuzzi tub was great and the bathroom was large. The inside pool and hot tub were very nice---also not crowded, and open till midnight. My husband enjoyed the exercise room. You had to use your room key to enter the exercise room. The continental breakfast was great! Very clean and stocked well. Fresh doughtuts, bagels, hot and cold cereal, toast, boiled eggs, fruit, coffee, tea, juices, etc. The hostess was very friendly and nice. The front desk clerks were nice too, and helpful with information about the Branson area. The lobby had a pretty relaxing rock waterfall and tables where we played cards with others from our group, while we waited for everyone to gather for our outings. All in all it was a good pick for our six day stay. I would stay there again when visiting Branson.

HotelInfo.Name: Cascades Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3226 Shepherd of the Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616
